Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's think this through. If we ask Corporate for that then...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They are either going to say yes... or no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could go either way. We don't know what they are going to say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Think it through.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have to think it through. Because if they say no...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can we not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! Yes, we have to! You know why? Because I don't like to be cooped up in that office! In that box! All day long. [Michael starts playing with a football in the office] Heisman! Because I need to think. Okay, Jim? Oh, Kevin, oh! [laughs] Nice catch. Mmmm, mmm, mmm,mmm. Os-car! Intercepted.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Still want that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give it to me. Phyllis, give me the ball. Ok, give me the ball. Give me, you guys... Creed give me the ball! Right now give it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fumble! Yaaah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hut! Hut! Hut! Hike!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You all right Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ooh. They're having a sale on TiVo. Maybe I should get a TiVo. Oh. DVD Burner! Maybe I should get one of those. You are so lucky, Jim. You are so lucky you don't have this problem. What was the 9th place prize again? A loaf of bread?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cugino's pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Tasty, terrific pizza. Hmm. Question: Do their pizzas play DVDs?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight was the top salesman of the year at our company. He wins a little prize money and gets honored at some convention. It is literally the highest possible honor that a Northeastern Pennsylvania-Based Mid-size Paper Company Regional Salesman can attain, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What did I do to deserve this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you sad that Dwight beat you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you going to cry, Jim? Do you need a tissue?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, I heard you got a wedding dress. Do you have pictures?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! I... uh... yeah. Um... I'll uh show them to you later.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I should get back. Talk to you guys later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have a ton of stuff to do for the wedding. And I have to do it in the office. And that can be kind of awkward. Um... just because people can get all weird about wedding stuff. Then... I just... I don't want to offend... Angela... or someone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha! I don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Grapes. Seductive. So you ready for the big speech this afternoon?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, it's not really a big speech. You still coming right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Abso-fruit-ly. Fruit. Grapes. Nailed the joke. Matter of time. Um... And yes, it is a big speech. Biggest of your life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Speaker at the Sales Convention. Been there, done that. Went there again, did it again. Two years in a row. Consecutive. I just... I miss the feeling of knowing that you did a good job because someone gives you proof of it. Sir, you're awesome! Here's a plaque. What, a whole year has gone by and you need more proof? Here's a certificate. They stopped making plaques that year.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What if I give a really long, extended Thank You. For instance, "Thank you, Mr. Blank. Thank you very, very, very..."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That would look terrible. These are mostly salesmen and salesmen expect to be entertained and you are the main act.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When I was in the sixth grade, I was a finalist in our school Spelling Bee. It was me against Raj Patel. And I misspelled, in front of the entire school, the word 'failure'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's because you're incapable of doing it because you don't know how. Because you have no skills. Dwight, there's no way I can possibly teach you what you need to know about public speaking by speech time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But I can teach you enough so that you don't embarrass me or the company.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, deal! I'll do whatever you say. No questions asked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, if you have a question, you should ask me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll try and think of one. When...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't. Don't try and think of a question to humor me. Just... try not to be such an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that an insult or is that part of the public speaking advice?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Insult.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mom, I'm sorry. I know you and Dad are chipping in for the wedding but I do not want orange invitations. Yes! Well, if you really want my...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi, yeah, can I talk to one of your travel agents?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going to take a trip. I'm going to get out of town for a while... and go someplace... not here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where do I want to go? Um... that is an excellent question. And one I should have probably thought about before I called you. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I get here early every morning so I can set the thermostat. I like it a little cooler, around 66 degrees. I'm more productive. Maybe some people don't like it as cold as I do, but I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stand up comic voice] But seriously, what's the difference between a salesman and a saleswoman?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Saleswoman has a vagina.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a joke, Dwight. It's not a Sex Ed class.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But I'm right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, you're right about the difference between a man and a woman, but not about the punch line to the joke, right? [stand up comic voice] The difference between a salesman and a saleswoman... is boobs!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Do you remember the speeches that you gave?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. Both of them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Could I have a copy of one of them?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no! They would remember them. Look, it doesn't matter what you say. It just matters that you're saying something that people care about. Yeah? All right? Here we go. Watch this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention everybody! Attention please! I have some very great news from Corporate. We had a wonderful quarter and as a result all of you are getting bonuses for 1000 dollars!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [generalized clapping and cheering] Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You see that? You see how they responded to me? In that moment, I had them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is so great about the bonus!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no! It's not true. I was just talking so just go out there and say anything. They'll eat it up. They're a great audience.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Go ahead. Get the wallpaper. Wallpaper the ceiling if you want. Call Terri and tell her she...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's unbelievable!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me! May I have your attention please? There has been an accident on 84 West. Cars have skidded off the road into the safety railing. Several cars have flipped. There is broken glass everywhere. Several people are injured.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do we know anyone who was in the accident?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Brad Pitt. Also there will be no bonuses.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why would this affect our bonuses?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They are unrelated.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Is Brad okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He will never act again. Also, this branch is closing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What the hell is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are we out of jobs?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is karma because of what he did to Jennifer Aniston.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's kidding. Dwight was kidding and I don't know why because it wasn't funny... and it was just horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You said we were getting bonuses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Everybody in the conference room now. Let's go. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Cancel wallpaper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As your leader and your friend, I sort of demand that you can all speak in public as I can... and did... twice. [speaking to camera] You saw the plaque, right? [to office] All right. We're all going to go around the room and we're going to make toasts. And that way, we will overcome our fear of public speaking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You mean Toastmasters?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam! I'm public speaking. Stop public interrupting me. Actually, this would be good practice for your wedding toast.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, the bride doesn't really do... Have you ever been to a wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Good. Jim taking the initiative.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So. Uh... I am going on a trip. But not really sure where I'm going yet. It's kind of open-ended. So I was hoping maybe you guys would have some suggestions?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You should go to Hedonism.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's like Club Med, but everything is naked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was thinking more like Europe. Or something like that. But, good second choice.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Been to Amsterdam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh ho hokay. You know what? That's not a toast. You're not standing up.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [mimes lifting a glass] To Amsterdam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When did you go there?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Umm... After my divorce. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really for like how long?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, about a week. Er... .um... .maybe a month. I uh can't...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Jimmy, listen to me. You do not want to go to Amsterdam. Trust me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where do I want to go?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'd send you to Hong Kong.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Like to say 'Hi' to my friends in China. [speaks in Chinese]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight. Show us what you have learned today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good morning, Vietnam! [general groaning] Okay. You know what? This isn't working. Because um I'm not nervous in front of them. They're my subordinates.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. We're not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, yes you are. I'm Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which means absolutely nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, can you explain?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's mostly made up. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight is not going to do a job. It's sad. And they're expecting excellence because I did do such a good job. Two years in a row. I killed. It was amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Confidence, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight. If you could travel anywhere in the world where would you go?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can travel anywhere except Cuba. And I will travel to New Zealand. And walk the 'Lord of the Rings' trail to Mordor. And then I will hike Mount Doom. So... no... just leave me alone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Just trying to get some advice on my trip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh please! You're not taking any trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know I majored in Public Speaking in College.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmmhmm. And the first thing they teach you is that you've got to be true to your self. And you are all about authority.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. I am.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The great speakers throughout history were not joke tellers. They were people of passion. So if you want to do well today, you got to do what they did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which is?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've got to wave your arms and you've got to pound your fists. Many times. It's supposed to emphasize your point.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I didn't actually major in Public Speaking. But, I did download speeches from some of history's famous dictators. Like this one [holds up paper]. Originally given by Benito Mussolini.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, look. I know you are giving this speech on your own but I wrote up a few talking points for you to take a look at. I hope you don't mind.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll glance at it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's time, Dwight. The grim reaper is here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The very best of luck to you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why'd you pick the V.A. for the reception?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy has a connection. It's nicer than you think.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You're inviting Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course. He's one of my closest friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. You ready? Here we go! Wow. It's a little bit bigger than I remember. Come on. We're down here. Right.

Quote.Speaker: Overhead
Quote.Text: [song] You all ready for this?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [coughs] [sniffles] I am just feeling under the weather. And... I think that I will go home and rest.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I've never, ever seen you take a sick day.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I've seen you take enough for the both of us.

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: Next, I'd like to introduce the Dunder Mifflin Salesman of the Year, Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [polite clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, they called your name.

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: Dwight, how we doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I can't... I ca...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. You know what? Okay. No. No problem. You are lucky you have me here. I'm going to cover for you. [shouts] All right!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gooood morning, Vietnaaaam! I am not Dwight Schrute. Not at all. I am Michael Scott, his mentor and boss. And until Dwight comes up, if he ever does, I wanted to say a few words about excellence. What makes a work environment excellent? Well, there are many things, I believe, that do such a thing of that nature. And one would be humor. What is the difference between a salesman and a saleswoman?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I always set it at 69. [snickers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe we'll use a DJ. That's the one thing Roy's in charge of for this wedding but all he's managed to do is set a date.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But he did a great job. June 10th is perfect. I want a June wedding. I've always wanted one. Ryan, do you know when you would want to get married?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Actually, I don't see myself ever getting married.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ryan, you should be more sensitive. It's obvious she likes you and comments like that, they just...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm very sorry. I did not know you were wearing a hearing aid and I just thought you were speaking abnormally. ...And now the black guy from the 'Police Academy' movies. A robot. [makes robot sounds] Michael Winslow, anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Car starting. [makes car sounds] All right, Dwight Schrute everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good luck. That is a tough crowd.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [bangs fists] Blood alone moves the wheels of history! Have you ever asked yourselves in an hour of meditation, which everyone finds during the day. [waves arm] how long we have been striving for greatness? [bangs fist] Not only the years we've been at war, the war of work, but from the moment as a child when we realized that the world could be conquered. It has been a lifetime's struggle [waves arms]. A never-ending fight. I say to you [hits podium] and you'll understand that it is a privilege to fight!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: WE ARE WARRIORS!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [clapping and cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Salesman of Northeastern Pennsylvania, I ask you once more rise and be worthy of this historical hour!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [clapping and cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs maniacally] Yeah. Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I've got a time share in Key West that might be available.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You really think you're going to go?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm definitely going.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nice. Send me a postcard.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Jim has worked at the same place for five years. Jim eats the same ham and cheese sandwich everyday for lunch. I don't know. If I were a betting man, I'd say he will have a fun weekend in Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No revolution is worth anything unless it can defend itself. [bangs fists]

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Some people will tell you salesman is a bad word. They'll conjure up images of used car dealers and door to door charlatans. This is our duty - to change their perception. I say salesmen... and women of the world unite! We must never acquiesce for it is together, TOGETHER, THAT WE PREVAIL! We must never cede control of the motherland! For it is...

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [shouts] Together that we prevail! [cheering and clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Australia? I have always wanted to go there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going. I'm a little nervous to run into Dwight on his connecting flight to Mordor. But, other than that... um, yeah, I bought the ticket, non-refundable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's awesome. Where are you staying?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. I feel like I have plenty of time to figure out the details but...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When are you leaving?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm... leaving on June 8th.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. And I'm really sorry about that, I just...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. That's too bad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Do you want me to take these on my way out?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's ok. I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, thanks. [to Michael] There you are. What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got thirsty. How'd it go?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was amazing. I wish you would have been there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You would not believe what happened here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Something happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! This woman came in, sat down, ordered a drink. The bartender asked for her ID which I thought was odd because I pegged her at like 35.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was weird. So, she was like 'I don't have my ID, please give me one.' And he was like 'I can't do that. I can't serve you.'

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Con artist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She might have been. So she says 'Fine. I will go to my room. I will get my purse. I will come back. I'll show you my ID.' She hasn't come back yet. She's probably in her room drinking from the mini-bar! Right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight gave a great speech. That's the word on the street anyway. And I entertained Dwight to no end with my bar stories. So, I captivated the guy who captivated a thousand guys. Can you believe that? A thousand guys?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My future is so bright, Jim. Jim, do you know how bright my future is? It's so bright that... What? Do you know? Is there something I got to wear? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Goggles?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [imitating '80s rock]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And what a lot of people don't understand about sales is that it has so much to do with organization. I have a system in place for keeping track of who I speak to, when I speak to them and what we have discussed. Etcetera.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it? You're going to end with "etcetera"? Okay, what's this big organizational system that...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, do you think I should describe our filing system?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That would be suicide. Never, never talk specifics. Not in a speech. But the fact that you have no idea what to say is, believe it or not, the least of our worries.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's your delivery...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Our biggest worry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't follow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My God, Dwight. The best way to learn is by watching. That's why porn is a multi-trillion-dollar industry. Listen. Okay. Sit down, let me wow you. [clears throat] [shouting]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See, I have your attention now, don't I? You're scared, but now you're ready to learn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, that didn't go well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it did not. And that is because at no time did you employ the use of humor. We'll find you a joke that not even you can ruin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, listen up, please. Dwight has a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering to Angela] Stop it. [to the office] Two sailors walk into a bar...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Please don't tell a sailor joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, why not?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Her nephew's in Iraq.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Iraq is sand. Sailors are on water.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, but they are both in danger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, you know what? We need to... All right, everybody in the conference room now. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's gonna start. How about Phyllis? You kick us off and then we'll move around. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are we supposed to talk about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anything your heart desires.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I would like to toast to the good fortune I've been having lately...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [shouting] Louder!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I, uh, I met a man and I'm totally in love, and that's a chapter of my life that I thought had closed. Uh, I was terribly depressed for the longest time and I have to admit I had some very dark thoughts...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Good, good, good. That's good. Now see, that's not so hard, right? All right. Who's next? Who are we going to... Ryan. Ryan's next.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why am I next? I thought we'd go in order?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't be shy, shy boy. Don't be shy. Get up there.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well... A lot of you know that I'm in business school. And while I'm learning a lot here, a lot, hopefully soon I'll land a challenging full-time or part-time position somewhere else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Way to go, Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop! Stop! Stop! That's, you know what? The toast is really not supposed to be about anything. It's certainly not supposed to be about going anywhere or doing anything else, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan is a temp, and that means that he could go at any time. Am I worried about that? Try scared to death.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I got the stamps.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The ones that say "love" on them?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The ones that say "39 cents."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I didn't think it did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: As soon as they leave, well get Kelly and start.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly's helping?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is that okay?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ghosts. Lots of ghosts in this old Radisson. There it is, Rosebud Room. Memories. Wow, this turnout is pathetic. I packed the house, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I don't think this is it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Numismatic. Numismatic Collectors. Nope, wrong room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. They got sports medicine seminar, nope. Science fiction convention, nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, I read about that. The entire cast of Battlestar Galactica is gonna be here, including Starbuck. I'm so in love with her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're weird.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. It's totally normal, 'cause she's not a Cylon or anything. She's just a great human fighter pilot. If I see her, my heart will explode.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you a 12-year-old girl? I don't know. There we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, look at me. I'm huge in Wilkes-Barre. Performing nightly, Michael Scott. Not comedy fans here, which is fine because not having a sense of humor is just as fine as having one. Questions? Comment? Can't see you, but I know that you're not breathing. I know you're breathing. Is this on? Hello? "Well, isn't that... Well, isn't that special?" "Jell-O pudding." Bill Cosby. I think Bill Cosby said it best when he talked about his brother and all of the fun he... All the great things they did together as kids. And there was the one time when he put the snowball in the freezer, and it... And he waited for five months and then he took the snowball out and he threw it... He would have thrown it at the kid but then his mother had thrown out the snowball so he couldn't throw it. So... Bill Cosby is smoking! And now some race car. [imitating race car engine] That brings me to my... Brings me to a point that you should always have a list of your clients. It's important to because a client list is next to godliness... List. [baby crying] Could you shut him up, please? I mean, who brings a baby to a sales conference? Really rude.
